intro: Licaria cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its striking foliage and floral display.
